agent_utterance:
Here are quick, actionable tips to log mood and hunger more efficiently while you follow your flexible start and coping options:

- Use a tiny 4-field micro-log after breathing:
  - Mood: rate 1–5 (1 = very low, 5 = very good). Add a one-word descriptor if you like (calm, restless, overwhelmed).
  - Hunger: rate 0–4 (0 = not hungry, 4 = very hungry).
  - Urge intensity: 0–10 (0 = no urge, 10 = strongest urge).
  - Action taken: check boxes for box breathing, 10-minute walk, journaling, quick call, snack, water.

- Have a default template you can tap quickly:
  Mood: __ /5 • Hunger: __ /4 • Urge: __ /10 • Actions: [Breathing] [Walk] [Journaling] [Call] [Snack] [Water]
  (If you’re in a rush, fill the essential fields only: Mood, Hunger, Urge, and one action you took.)

- Use simple descriptors instead of numeric values when you’re short on time:
  - Mood: calm, neutral, stressed, tired, irritable
  - Hunger: none, light, moderate, strong

- Log immediately after the breathing as you planned, then add mood/hunger and any quick notes in one line if possible.

- Keep it consistent with prompts you already use:
  - Tonight: Box breathing completed → Mood/Hunger logged → Urges 0–10 → Coping action chosen → Snack/Water if needed.

- Create quick-entry hooks (what you can memorize):
  - After breathing: “Mood: 3; Hunger: 2; Urge: 6; Action: Walk”
  - After craving spike response: “Walk done; Journaling next if urge persists.”

- Use a simple reminder workflow:
  - Reminder to start when urges rise.
  - If you miss logging, do a 1-minute breathing plus one quick log entry as soon as you remember.

- Visual aids help: a small card or note with the log fields you keep by your device, or a one-line template you can copy-paste.

- Hydration cue: since it’s warm (32°C), add “Water: yes/no” to the log so you remember to sip during cravings.

If you’d like, I can craft a ready-to-use one-line log template you can memorize or paste into your log app. Would you prefer a printable card or a digital template (short, one-line, or multi-field) you can quickly tap?

agent_utterance: Short, actionable guidance: 1) Post-log urge spike: log again as soon as you can and add a brief note indicating the spike occurred after the initial log (include approximate time). If you don’t have time for a full entry, add a one-line note to capture the spike. 2) Custom reminders: yes—set separate reminder profiles: one for Home/Evening (e.g., prompts around your typical craving window and a pre-bed check) and one for Out/On-the-Go (short, quick prompts when you’re away from home). If possible, pair reminders with your breathing cue so you transition quickly. 3) Keep the backup card printed and templates on your phone for offline use. 4) If you miss logging, do a 1-minute box breathing and log as soon as you remember. 5) Hydration note: warm weather increases thirst—log Water yes/no and sip regularly. 6) Labels can be tweaked later to fit your language. Check in tomorrow to share what worked and any tweaks you want.
